headline: Naan
description: A delicious naan recipe you can make at home for soft, chewy naan with a rich, buttery taste, just like what you'd find at your favorite Indian restaurant.
name: Naan

recipeInstructions.text: Dissolve yeast in warm water in a large bowl. Let stand about 10 minutes, until frothy.
Meanwhile, generously oil a large bowl.
Stir sugar, milk, egg, and salt into the yeast mixture. Mix in enough flour to make a soft dough.
Knead dough on a lightly floured surface until smooth, 6 to 8 minutes.
Place dough in the prepared oil, cover with a damp cloth, and let rise until doubled in size, about 1 hour.

Punch down dough on a lightly floured surface, and knead in garlic. Pinch off small handfuls of dough about the size of a golf ball; you should have about 14. Roll each piece into a ball and place on a tray. Cover with a towel, and allow to rise until doubled in size, about 30 minutes.
Meanwhile, preheat a large grill pan over high heat.
Roll each piece of dough into a thin circle.

Brush some melted butter on the preheated grill pan. Place a few pieces of dough in the pan (as many as you can fit) and cook until puffy and lightly browned, 2 to 3 minutes. Brush butter onto the uncooked sides, flip, and cook until browned, 2 to 4 more minutes. Remove from the grill and repeat to cook the remaining naan.

review.reviewBody: This was a really easy recipe. I use a Ninja Foodie Processor with dough blade to make all my doughs. Turned out great and chewy. Does make quite a few so had plenty of lunch leftovers for my husband and I.
Yummy!
It was an easy recipe to follow, and it tastes amazing.

I’d given up on finding a great pizza crust recipe until I made these naan for personal size pizzas. DELISH! I usually make a half batch on the dough setting of bread machine - the only change is to cook them in a hot, dry frying pan. They freeze well & thaw quickly for a speedy meal idea. Just add sauce, toppings & cheese then pop under the broiler for about 5 minutes. We love this recipe!
was great i love recipes i can do quickly
I made this exactly as written, and I wish I had the camera ready when my husband tasted them, he was absolutely shocked!! These are sooooo goooood!! Wonderful recipe, Thank you!!

First timer, 3 hours in the kitchen, yes, but worth it. Supper buttery, chewy and light texture. I preferred my cast iron grill plate over the non-stick grill. Note: I was only able to work 4 cups of flour.

This was really, really good and so easy to make! I was even exceptionally lazy about the process and cut a few corners, and it came out as chewy, delicious naan with a subtle garlic flavor. Things I did that weren't mentioned in the recipe: 1. I didn't have milk, so I substituted in heavy cream. 2. I didn't grill them. I just used a nonstick pan because it was convenient. 3. I absolutely obliterated the garlic until they were in tiny, tiny pieces. It was raw when I added it to the dough and I didn't want to bite into a giant piece! 4. When frying them, I brushed each side that was facing up with butter, then sprinkled with a very small amount of kosher salt. 5. Medium high heat would be WAY too high for my stove. I set it to from setting 3-4 out of 10 and it still got a great char/cooked fully. 6. I got too impatient waiting for the second rise, and only gave them about 10 minutes. I would recommend giving them the full time if possible, but...I was gettin a little hangry. I paired it with the curry stand tikka masala also on this site, and it was so. Good. I would give it a try!

I've had this in "recipe box" for some time and decided to make it to serve with shrimp curry. Easy-to-follow recipe. Several commentators recommended including the sugar in the water in the proofing the yeast. I don't usually do this when proofing yeast but figured it couldn't hurt so I did - not convinced it was necessary. I cooked them on an electric griddle so I could do several at once. Very pleased with the results. We'll make this recipe again.

delicious! I made it on my grill out back with coals from our evening fire, it cooked fast, with a crispy outside and soft inside, it also opens easily to form a pocket if you like to put your food in a pocket-bread. I followed another person's advice about making garlic butter and brushing it onto the bread before cooking, rather than kneading the garlic in. it was perfection.

Best Naan recipe! I make it frequently and always when I make Indian foods. It is always a huge hit with friends and family. It is also great to freeze and thaw for use whenever you need it. And we like to use it occasionally to make individual pizzas with.
Great recipe that makes delicious naan bread!
Great alternative to naan from an Indian grocery store. Have made this recipe for a few years and turns out amazing every time. Do not change anything!
Absolutely delicious recipe as it is all by itself with nothing added or taken away ,thank you so much Bob for posting this recipe.
Roll very thin. Made mixture of melted butter and garlic, but do not put on grill directly, butter and garlic start to burn.

roll in garlic salt. 
keeps for 4 days after 1st rise
this is a very good recipe I couldn't roll it as thin as they do in an Indian restaurant but it was good
Really nice flavor, texture, and color. I used sweet vidalia onion, and black turkey figs, because that’s what I had on hand. Served on crackers with a smear of cream cheese. Delicious!
I doubled the recipe and only needed seven cups of flour. The measurements are way off.

SÚPER soft! The dough took a little longer than expected to rise. First time I made it didn’t find the garlic taste to be strong enough. Second time omitted the garlic from the dough and included it in the oil used to brush the naan. More authentic but slightly burned.
So easy and tasty. Naan is expensive in the store so I tried this recipe and this is so much better plus so fresh. I now make it once a week since everybody loves it

This recipe turns out great. Instead of making small naans, I divide the dough in quarters and roll out thin into large ovals. I then placed on grill until bubbling then turned. I used these for flatbread pizzas. Freezes well.

Best home made naan I've made to date it compares or is better than your local restaurant I wouldn't add anything to this recipe just cook it properly! I use a cast iron pan on high heat and the signature bubbles and flavor come through so amazingly. Thank You for this recipe!
This naan recipe is perfection! I want to try to make butter chicken pizza with this naan as the base
This recipe is fun and delicious, the first attempt at this, and I’ll make it again. Note on proofing: Add 1 teaspoon sugar to the warm water and yeast. Otherwise no changes!

This recipe was so easy and produced tender naan that my family loved. I saw some reviews that said you really needed bread flour, not all purpose flour, so I made sure to use my bread flour and I was so happy with the results. I don't have a grill so I used a nonstick skillet on medium heat. I'm saving this recipe as a favorite and will make it again.

I love this recipe! Makes sure to proof your yeast, only use 3 ½ cups of flour and ½ teaspoon of baking soda and it will turn out perfectly! Also, I have found using my counter top griddle on the highest setting works just good as, if not better than my pizza stone in a super hot oven. I have made this many times over the past 6-7 years and this is a wonderful recipe.
My whole family loves it. I used half whole wheat and half AP flour. Cooked it in my oven at 550 with fan. Only took 2 minutes per batch. Added a few drops of ghee on top. ??
Delicious!

This recipe was very good! I think 4 1/2 cups was a bit too much flour, though. The dough was dry and crumbly and not really coming together into a nice ball so I had to add more milk and some olive oil to moisten the dough a bit. It came together nicely after that. Next time, I'll probably cut it down to 4 cups of flour and see what the dough looks like. I didn't have an indoor grill, so I decided to cook the bread in a large cast iron pan on low to medium heat. That worked beautifully. The recipe was quite large so I froze half of the dough balls. This recipe is a keeper and I will definitely be making it again.

My 1st time making naan bread, it will not be the last! Even though I forgot to add the garlic, the naan was so delicious! I used my bread machine on the dough setting to do all of the work, and then removed the dough, shaped it for the 2nd rise. Cooked on an oiled grill pan indoors. It went well with my Chicken Rice Curry entree.

So good on the grill! I make this every time I make Chicken Tikka Masala- it's the perfect addition to the meal. My hubs grills while I make the rest inside. I used to buy grocery store naan and now I can never go back lol.

This recipe is easy to follow and was so good!! I used regular flour instead of bread flour, and my dough took longer to rise than indicated here. Once I stretched it just right, I was able to get those beautiful air bubbles. Highly recommend for newbies like me.
Made it according to the instructions came out perfect I loved it family loved it to?
I also followed the 3 1/2 cups of flour ratio and added a bit of baking soda, then added a little more flour when kneading and it came out pretty close to restaurant quality.
This was so easy. Instead of adding the garlic to the dough I put it in the melted butted. I cooked the naan in an iron skillets...it turned out perfectly!
I needed to add just a touch more flour than the recipe required to make the dough less sticky and easy to roll. Super delicious on our indoor smokeless grill!
The best naan I ever made with this recipe. I made it with self-raising flour instead of plain flour. It was so delicious soft
Easy to follow and delicious. First few came out not so good but after that they looked beautiful.
Making it for the second time, as the first time was delicious! Has anyone tried freezing the dough, or know if I can? If so, what’s the process? I made about 30 golf balls and can’t eat them all!
Wow! Great recipe.
Love this naan recipe ! Froze leftover bread; paired it with Chef John’s Tikka Masala and my husbands chili.
Best naan recipe hands down! Just 2 things I wanted to share. For best possible rise, place in oven with boiling hot water. Also, a cast iron skillet worked perfect instead of grill.
Love making and grilling these and then serving warm with the Black Bean Hummus Allrecipe. I also appreciate the ability to half the recipe easily by adjusting the servings.
Easy recipe with fantastic results. I'll never buy Naan again!

Pretty easy recipe for really good Naan bread. I got my natural gas grill piping hot and oiled the grill so there were good grill marks on the bread. Each side only took a minute or two. This Naan bread was excellent with my Chicken Tikka Masala.
These were super easy to make. I tried frying the dough and covering them in powdered sugar, my son loves them!
Love it! 4.5 cups of bread flour is 571.5 g. I also add 2 tbsp of yogurt.

Great!!! A little work, time and lots of mess :) but totally worth it! 
I added Cavenders Greek seasoning to the dough (an Arkansas product, find some, you will love it!)
Bad recipe, too much flour, too much sugar
perfect. I sprinkled a lil himalayan salt after the butter. o.m.g.

You won't need all 4.5 C of flour so only add until you have the right consistency. Otherwise you will end up with a rock. My family loves this for personal pizzas. They freeze well between parchment (after they are cooked and cooled). I cook them on a dry grill at med temp and avoid the mess of oil/butter. They brown up beautifully!

I used fresh ground hard white wheat to make these and that was the only change I made to them. They turned out amazing. The whole family loved them so I will be making these more. Thank you for such a great recipe.

Instead of bread flour, I used All Purpose flour. I also added honey with the sugar. As soon as the bread was cooked, I immediately basted them with butter. Adding minced garlic on top by rubbing it on bread with finger.
I made according to directions i think i made the dough a little thick but it turned out well. its a great and easy recipe for those wanting to learn how to make naan.
About 3 1/2 cups flour until dough pulls from bowl

My husband loves naan but it is expensive to buy so I thought I would try to make it myself. I altered the recipe a bit. I cut the sugar to 3 tablespoons and added a 1/2 teaspoon of baking soda and 2 teaspoons of garlic powder. Since I am going to use the naan for gyros, I made the dough balls a bit bigger than a golf ball size. They turned out soft and chewy and otherwise just perfect!
I used little over 3.5 cups flour. Turned out very nice
I've made this several times, my family loves it. I cook it on a cast iron stove top grill

Great recipe.. I use the bread machine, due to limited time chasing around kids!. We love garlic so I mix it in just before making the balls for the final rise. Taste great and is a family hit. I only use 4 cups of flour in the machine and will add more if need be while rolling them out.
very good recipe. However, only used half a cup of yeast+warm water as that was all I had. still turned out great! also substituted garlic with garlic powder. very yummy!
I added 1/4 tsp baking soda into the flour. This is an excellent bread and simple to make. I baked it on an electric griddle. Baked beautifully and the family loved it.

This is really excellent. So easy to make.

I suggest using instant yeast instead, and just whisking together all the dry ingredients before adding the wet ingredients. I also used only 4 cups of flour, 4 and a half would make the dough WAY too dry. Also used garlic powder instead of legitimate garlic the second time which worked incredibly well to get the garlic flavor throughout all of the bread.

But yeah, this is seriously a good and easy to follow recipe. Love it.

Great recipe. I didnt have a grill pan so just used a skillet. I made no changes to the recipe, rolled the dough out with a rolling pin and then used fingers to push and pinch the dough to make it look look round. These bubbled and cooked perfectly. Thank you.
Definitely great except you need more than 2 minutes per side, there is barely enough color on them.
Absolutely delicious! I will use this recipe over and over again!

Extremely easy and tasted great! I took other’s suggestions and used bread four and mixed the flour in one cup at a time. I think I used three cups of flour overall on the dough itself and another cup for rolling it out. I used the left over bread for pizza the next day.

My 9 yr old granddaughter had fun making this recipe. It was easy and delicious! The only thing we did differently was add a bit of garlic powder (her idea) but it would’ve been just as tasty without it.
First time making naan. Turned out perfect! I did proof the yeast with sugar and used grated fresh baby garlic. Wonderful!

This naan is amazing but we boil water and place it in the oven (off) to allow them to rise better both times and we make a butter and herb (rosemary, basil, a little garlic powder, thyme) mix that we brush each side with before cooking and they are even more amazing.

Great naan bread! Didn't use fresh garlic in the dough (would have been too much garlic in some bites) and instead sprinkled a very conservative amount of garlic powder. Used a cast iron skillet be careful to not use too high of heat or it would quickly char too much - and don't use much oil or they will be greasy. Kept warm on a pizza stone on low heat in the oven until dinner.

This recipe was fabulous. Whole family gobbled them along side meat and veggie shish kabobs. The portion is substantial, with one recipe feeding two adults and two tweens generously, for two meals. The left overs were carefully portioned out the next day, lest anyone get even a bite less than anyone else!

Made them exactly per recipe, though let them rise longer the first time, simply because I made them too early in the afternoon. Grilled them on an outdoor gas grill, which was made much easier with the assistance of my wife, who rolled them out grill-side whilst I grilled, buttered, flipped, and plated these lovely treats. Will definitely make again.

Chose this recipe among others because it had high ratings and 1k+ reviewers. That says a lot! 

I thought it was doomed to fail when 1) no foam formed, but only had few tiny bubbles and 2) my dough did not rise within an hour. After reading the other reviews here, I realized the recipe did not mention that sugar had to be added in the yeast proofing step. Nevertheless, it still turned out great! There were a lot of bubbles and it tasted good too. My family loved it!

I'm willing to try this again using bread floor and adding sugar when proofing my yeast.

This is amazing! I gave it four stars only because I ended up using 3.5 cups of flour and a tsp of garlic powder instead of minced, it was fantastic that way. So, so good! We make them almost every weekend now. I also had to use instant yeast (all I have) so I decreased the yeast amount and proof time by 25%. The first time I made these I made golf ball sized like the recipe calls for but the second time I tried a little larger and it was still very, very good. This recipe does make a couple dozen naan so after the second proof when they’re in balls I froze half. The next weekend I thawed in room temp water for 30 minutes and they came out just as good. I recommend playing around with stuffing these. After the ball proof I rolled them out about half way, put a tbsp of filling then continued rolling them out. Don’t be afraid of rolling over the filling, it incorporates into the dough that way. It also takes me about 20-30 minutes to roll out half the balls so it’s not really ‘grill side’. Plan your time accordingly. We’ve stuffed them with various ingredients. One was just cheese and garlic (omitting the garlic from the earlier step). One was potatoes (I cheated and used hash brown leftovers) and cheese, one mix was chopped, really dry cherries and unsalted pistachios, next I’m going to try dates and feta! The combos are endless.
this recipe was simple to follow and turned out delicious. it was my first time making naan bread so I was a bit nervous but it turned out great!

Love this recipe! I have made it many times, and they reliably turn out great! Good flavor with just the right amount of chewiness. I sometimes substitute buttermilk for the regular milk. I cook them on a cast iron skillet and then keep them warm in the oven. Everyone who has had these has complimented me on them and many have asked for the recipe!

Excellent recipe! Super easy to follow, with delicious results!!! The kids gobbled it up!

This recipe actually made much more than what I needed for dinner, so I placed the extra balls of dough in a gallon-sized ziploc bag, spaced out, and froze them. I've done this before with tortilla dough, so I'm hoping it'll work here, too. I'll just leave them out for an hour or so to defrost within the next couple of days.
My family can't get enough. I have cooked it on the stove in a cast iron pan and it works great too.
Loved it ! Super easy to make and yummy ! I brushed butter and garlic on mine while it was on the grill and turned out great.
I'm not sure what I did wrong here. I usually get my recipes to work. I followed recipe exactly as it's written. My family asked that I not make this again.
delicious!!!!
Very tasty. Made it with garlic but didn't seem very garlicky. I think next time I will also add garlic powder to dough.
Delicious and easy to make

I only made a couple of minor adjustments. This was my first time making naan and it came out awesome. I didn't have bread flour and with the pandemic, flour is in short supply so I used AP, which worked out beautifully. I didn't mix the garlic in the dough, I was afraid it would be too overpowering so I added it to the melted butter and brushed it on both sides before grilling. For me, it added just the right amount of garlic flavor. I didn't have a grill pan so I used a regular saute pan and that worked just fine. Lastly, I rolled a few out thin like it states but it was too thin, I didn't get that chewy texture so rolled the rest to about a 1/4 of an inch. These are all minor items and I used the naan for chicken gyros...Oh my - so good!!!
Delicious

I read the 1st few reviews thank goodness otherwise I would not have added sugar to the yeast. as it is not included in the ingredients list. I added 1 tsp as my yeast jar asked.
Definitely a keeper!! Easy and fun to make, very tasty, my 12 year old is in love with this recipe thank you!

I think the naan is delicious. My family loved it. Definitely will make it again. 
Just a question abut the calories per serving. How is this measure, since each cup of flour is 455 calories and the recipe has 4 1/2 cups, so each serving should be a little more than 200 calories?

This turned out amazing! Great recipe. I used about 3.5-4 cups of flour and that seemed good using my kitchen aid. The dough is sticky so Floured the surface to create the balls. Also high heat was too much so turned it medium-low. The garlic kneaded in is brilliant! So soft and delicious. Thanks for sharing!
Super easy!
Great recipe! As others suggested, I used 3 1/2 cups of flour and some baking powder. Make sure you roll the balls out VERY thin. The thinner the better to get the characteristic bubbles!
Easy peasy only takes the time.
My yeast didn’t raise, but they were wonderful anyway
easy to follow recipe. Makes delicious naan. I saved leftover dough and made naan a few days in a row. I cut the amount of flour to 3 cups. Excellent recipe

Delicious! Having made this a few times, I would recommend only putting the butter on one side of the naan and leaving the other side plain. It’s delicious either way, but it’s easier to eat without so much butter.

This was a great recipe. I got the bubbles without needing to add anything else to the recipe but the grill must be the proper temperature (hot) or they won’t form. I also added the minced garlic right away. I have done this twice and it does not interfere with the rise of the dough. Another reviewer suggested adding the garlic to the melted butter. I did this also (yes-I love garlic!) and it really adds to the flavor. I do only half the recipe at a time. This makes PLENTY. I use a countertop electric grill set on high 4 minutes per side and it comes out perfectly. Highly recommend.

I made this today, 4/29/2020. During this pandemic I couldn't get naan bread from my grocery store. I followed the recipe with these changes: Based on other reviews I added tsp of sugar with the yeast so it could "proof" for 10 minutes, then I added a 1/2 tsp of baking soda to all the other ingredients in the mixture. I let my Kitchenaid knead the dough for me for 8 minutes. Rolled it out on a floured surface and it rose beautifully after an hour. Punched it down and let it rise again in 12-16 balls. Grilled it on our gas stove with a grill/griddle greased and on medium high. The naan bubbled up perfectly and I cooked each side 1 minute then flipped with tongs. Turned out perfect. Lots of leftovers that we froze. Perfect tast and texture. We melted 1 stick of butter with 2 tsp of garlic to baste on it since the 1/4 c was no where near enough. I am so Proud of myself! lol Woohoo! You can do this! Thanks so much for this recipe!

Made a lot. Family enjoyed them and they were relatively easy to make. I’m
Freezing a bunch so I hope they will still be yummy.
This was incredible. Made it exactly as is other than halving the recipe and adding a touch of baking soda. Will definitely make it again!!!!

It was delicious! I ended up using pizza dough dry active yeast and all purpose flour instead of regular yeast and bread flour and it was still a family hit! I also cooked it in a skillet. For skillet cooking, try the lowest heat setting and only a minute or so on each side. Worked great!
